Title: Evaluation of Governance Information System Using Framework Cobit 5 in Banking Company
Source title: ICSECC 2019 - International Conference on Sustainable Engineering and Creative Computing: New Idea, New Innovation, Proceedings
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master in Information System Management, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Legowo, N., Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master in Information System Management, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Christian, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master in Information System Management, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The majority of organizations or companies both public and private already use information technology as a support in improving the effectiveness and efficiency of business performance, it can impact on not achieving the business goals of the company. Every banking company in Indonesia is obliged to report monthly reports to Bank Indonesia for financial supervision, but on the use of reporting systems is perceived to be less than optimal. The IS audit control mechanism using this COBIT framework not only provides an evaluation of IT governance in the company, but also provides inputs that can be used to improve its management. COBIT 5 is therefore a benchmark for the process of appraising and improving IT governance. After the mapping obtained 7 processes for the measurement that is EDM02, APO02, APO11, BAI06, DSS01, DSS02, and DSS03. Result of each process, obtained the level of capability of each process EDM02 = Level 1, APO02 = Level 2, APO11 = Level 2, BAI06 = Level 2, DSS01 = Level 2, DSS02 = Level 2, and DSS03 = Level 1. The IT governance gap analysis is done by comparing the current level of IT governance capability with the target level to be achieved. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Banking Company; Business Goals; COBIT 5; IT Governance
Index Keywords: Sustainable development; Business goals; Business performance; COBIT 5; Current levels; Effectiveness and efficiencies; IT governance; Reporting systems; Target levels; Information use

Authors: Soewito B., Christian, Gunawan F.E., Diana, Gede Putra Kusuma I.
Title: Websocket to support real time smart home applications
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Industrial Engineering Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Industrial Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Soewito, B., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Christian, Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gunawan, F.E., Industrial Engineering Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Industrial Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Diana, Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gede Putra Kusuma, I., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As we already know, the IoT (Internet of Thing) system has developed and is used in many fields, such as agriculture, security, industry etc. The IoT system requires real time monitoring and this is one of the problems that exists today. Transfering data from the sensor via the internet network to a monitoring device must be less than 300 ms. One process that can cause non-fulfillment of these requirements is a method for displaying the data on a monitor. There are several methods for delivering data from the sensor to a monitor. This paper has been compared between two methods, namely the polling method and the websocket method. The experiment was conducted to compare these two method. The result obtained that the websocket method was better in presenting real time data compared to the polling method. It can be shown in bandwidth usage and memory usage. In the experiment was found that the average of bandwidth usage is 478KB for polling method, and 91KB for web socket method in web based and the memory consumption of websocket less as much as 16% compared to polling method. In android smartphone the average bandwidth usage is 5.1 KB for web socket method and 15 KB for polling method and the memory consumption of websocket less as much as 22% compared to polling method. © 2019 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V. This is an open access article under the CC BY-NC-ND license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/) Peer-review under responsibility of the scientific committee of the 4th International Conference on Computer Science and Computational Intelligence 2019.
Author Keywords: IoT; Polling method; Realtime; Smart home; Websocket
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Automation; Bandwidth; Monitoring; Network security; Android smartphone; Memory consumption; Monitoring device; Polling method; Real time; Real time monitoring; Smart homes; Websocket; Internet of things
Funding Details: Kementerian Riset, Teknologi dan Pendidikan Tinggi: 039/VR

Authors: Peranginangin E., Christian, Kaburuan E.R., Anshory B.J., Girsang A.S.
Title: Motion Gesture Game for Measure Kinesthetic Level
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Orange Technologies, ICOT 2018
Affiliations: Product Design Program, Podomoro University, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate, Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Peranginangin, E., Product Design Program, Podomoro University, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Christian, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kaburuan, E.R., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate, Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Anshory, B.J., Product Design Program, Podomoro University, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: One of the purposes of playing a game is for entertainment. However, some games have multipurpose, not only for fun but also for research. The goals of this research are design game with motion gesture which can measure kinesthetic learning style. The user can move their hands as interaction control, replacing old navigation. Data is collected by distributing questionnaire and game score to participants. Analysis data uses index learning styles and pearson correlation. It concluded that using motion gesture game for measure method learning style can help to measure a kinesthetic player. The final result expected in this research is to help other researchers in game or learning styles. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Correlation methods; Design games; game; Interaction controls; kinesthetic; Learning Style; measure; Motion gestures; Pearson correlation; Citrus fruits

Authors: Adam A.R., Hidajat M., Danaparamita M., Stevanus B., Wijayakusuma A., Christian
Title: Plant encyclopedia with image matching on a web-based application: Evaluation and implementation of SURF algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adam, A.R., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Danaparamita, M., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Stevanus, B., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wijayakusuma, A., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Christian, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The Plantcyclopedia application is developed to provide plant information. The difference between this research application and others is the search feature based on an image. The search feature is designed to match the shape and orientation. This application uses a Speeded Up Robust Features (SURF) algorithm to conduct the matching feature process. The SURF algorithm is divided into three main steps. The first step is to retrieve the image information and turn it into a matrix, using a Hessian - Laplace Technique to define the feature point following the integral to reduce the computational time. It also uses a Difference of Gaussian in order to handle the object with an invariant scale. This process is called Fast Hessian. The second step is to define the orientation of the image using a Haar Wavelet Responses Technique. The third step is to match the feature points from both images using a four dimensional vector and K-Means as a classification technique. The result of this research is an application which is able to collect plant information using image matching. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Web services; CBIR; Classification technique; Dimensional vectors; encyclopedia; Research applications; Speeded up robust features; SURF; Web-based applications; Image matching
